choices.D:
VLAN 100 to Layer 2 VNI 1010 -
VLAN 200 to Layer 2 VNI 1010
choices.A:
VLAN 100 to Layer 2 VNI 2020 -
Test_Telco_VRF to Layer 3 VNI 5050
choices.B:
VLAN 100 to Layer 2 VNI 2020 -
VLAN 200 to Layer 2 VNI 5050
choices.C:
VLAN 100 to Layer 2 VNI 2020 -
Test_Telco_VRF to Layer 3 VNI 1010

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
"Egress VTEP only perform L2 lookup" == Asymmetric IRB == no L3VNI
Different VLANs should be mapped to different VNIs so routing happens on ingress => B

Selected Answer: A
In VXLAN, for Layer3 routing, a VRF must be bound to a Layer3 VNI. This makes A or C possible valid choises. In the diagram we see that vlan 300 is very likely bound to Layer2 VNI 1010. So this means that answer C is not correct because if VNI 1010 is a Layer2 VNI, we must use a different VNI ID for Layer3 routing. This lets A likely to be the correct answer.
A or B?

Selected Answer: A
For a inter-vni communication we must define a L3 VNI.

Selected Answer: B
We need Layer 2 VNI mappings for VLAN 100 and VLAN 200
What does inter-VNI communication even mean? Should it be inter-SVI?

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer must configure the physical domain and attach a VLAN pool to it. Which two commands accomplish this goal? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
“Logical Configuration: An XML file that includes all logical configuration settings such as service profiles, VLANs, VSANs, pools, and policies. You can use the file generated from this backup to import these configuration settings to the original fabric interconnect or to a different fabric interconnect. You cannot use this file for a system restore.”

Selected Answer: C
I think is C.
It should be Logical configuration with Preserve Identities box checked.

"If this checkbox is selected for Logical Configuration type of backup operation, the backup file preserves all identities derived from pools, including vHBAs, WWPNs, WWNN, vNICs, MACs and UUIDs."

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/GUI-User-Guides/Admin-Management/4-2/b_Cisco_UCS_Admin_Mgmt_Guide_4-2/m_backup_and_restore_configuration.html

Selected Answer: B
All Configuration—The backup file preserves all identities derived from pools, including vHBAs, WWPNs, WWNN, vNICs,

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B.
Since it needs service profile template settings, System configuration itself will not fulfill the requirement. So we have to get All configuration which consists of both the System and logical configurations.
this is CCCC

Selected Answer: C
see https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/GUI-User-Guides/Admin-Management/4-2/b_Cisco_UCS_Admin_Mgmt_Guide_4-2/m_backup_and_restore_configuration.html

questions.question_text: An engineer must perform a configuration backup of an existing Cisco UCS Manager environment. The backup file must contain all vNIC, vHBA, and service profile template settings. Also, the engineer must validate the backup before import and requires an XML output format. Which backup type must be used to meet these requirements?

choices.D:
Disable VSAN 1 in the VSAN database.
Assign VSAN 10 to the ISL.
Enable VSAN trunking on the port channel members.
Permit VSAN 10 in the FLOGI database.
choices.A:
Activate VSAN 10 in the vFC interface.
Associate VSAN 10 to interface vfc 1/1.
Enable vsan F-port-channel-trunk on the ISL.
Set encapsulation EISL on the switch port.
choices.C:
Configure VSAN 10 in the interface configuration.
Attach VSAN 10 to the VSAN database.
Enable VSAN trunking on fc1/1.
Filter all VSAN on the ISL.
choices.B:
Create VSAN 10 in the VSAN database.
Bind VSAN 10 to interface fc1/1 in the VSAN database.
Enable VSAN trunking on the ISL.
Allow VSAN 10 on the ISL.

questions.question_text:
An engineer is implementing VSANs on a Cisco MDS 9000 Series Switch with a native Fibre Channel. The deployment must meet these requirements:
• The host on port fc1/1 must be assigned to VSAN 10.
• The port channel 10 ISL must pass multiple VSANs, including VSAN 10.

Which configuration set meets these requirements?

discussion.content:
Option B is the correct answer**, as it clearly meets both requirements:

Assigns VSAN 10 to fc1/1.
Allows VSAN 10 and other VSANs on the ISL through trunking.

Agree with it:
clear text
(config)#interface fastEthernet 0/0
(config-if)#ip ospf authentication
(config-if)#ip ospf authentication-key TEST

md5
(config)#interface fastEthernet 0/0
(config-if)#ip ospf authentication message-digest
(config-if)#ip ospf message-digest-key 1 md5 TEST
